result.execSummary:
The defendant Ian T Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).
  • Entry into/onto Bldg/Constuct.Site/Room [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution of $16, 109.63 to R & R Insurance, joint/several with co-actors. To be paid as a Condition of Probation. Restitution hearing to be held on 6/20/2016 at 2:30 pm.

AS OF 3/10/2017:  $67,255.42 total. As follows  $47,107.89 made payable to CHUBB for reimbursement and $20,147.53 made payable to Kettle Moraine School District. To be paid joint and several with other co-defendants.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

It is the Defendant's burden to petition the Court to receive the benefit of expunction. Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations. (AS TO COUNT 2 ONLY)

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with the victim (Wales Elementary) or any Co-actors.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: Exhibits #11-13 from 3/10/17 restitution hearing.
Continuation and Stipulation for Return/Destruction of Exhibits

Attorney Kristi Nelson Foy appeared on behalf of victim Kettle Moraine School District.  Attorney Steven Harvey appeared on behalf of Chubb Insurance.   Defendant Ian T Anderson in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Defendant Jacob W Lange in court, in custody, with attorney John Joseph Grau.  Defendant Alec J. Brazeau in court, in custody, with attorney Matthew H. Huppertz.

Attorney Havey presents Exhibit #11, marked.  Attorney Foy advises the parties have reached a stipulation as to some of the restitution amounts.  

Dr. Patricia Deklotz, Superintendent of the Kettle Moraine School District, sworn in and examined by Attorney Foy.  Cross-examination by Attorney Grau.  Cross-examination by Attorney Huppertz.  Cross-examination by Attorney De Peters.  Cross-examination by Attorney Harvey.  

Dale Zabel, Director of Facility Services and Safety for the Kettle Moraine School District, sworn in and examined by Attorney Foy.  Cross-examination by Attorney Grau.  Cross-examination by Attorney De Peters.  

Exhibits #1 - 10, previously presented by Attorney Foy and marked, are received.  Attorney Foy presents Exhibit #12, marked and received.  Exhibit #11 is received.  No objection from any of the parties.  

Attorney Grau presents Exhibit #13, marked and received.  No objection from any of the parties.  

Alec Brazeau sworn in and examined by Attorney Huppertz.  Cross-examination by Attorney Harvey.  Court closes the evidentiary portion of the hearing.

Attorney Foy advises Court of stipulated amounts and amounts still in dispute.  Attorney Foy makes argument for restitution.   Attorney Harvey makes statement.  Attorney De Peters makes statement.  Attorney Huppertz makes statement.  Attorney Grau makes statement.  Attorney Foy makes final argument.  

Court finds that the request for reimbursement for security guards, security cameras, missing Mac book, reimbursement to Chubb Insurance and copying costs as reasonable.  Court denies the request for attorney fees.  
Court orders restitution, joint and several, as follows:

$47,107.89 made payable to CHUBB for reimbursement
$20,147.53 made payable to Kettle Moraine School District

records.addlTxt: Restitution hearing on June 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
(2) Victim Impact Statements, received and filed in court by the defendant.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Ian T Anderson in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  

State moves to add a count 3 a misdemeanor.  
Amended Information filed.
Defense has no objections.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to both counts 2 & 3.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of both counts 2 & 3.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read in.
Representative from Kettle Moraine School District presented a statement to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
Count 2:
1 Year in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
 STAYED. 

Term of Probation:  3 Years.
Consecutive to:  Count 3.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim (Wales Elementary School) or any co-actors.
DNA sample to be provided.
40 Hours of community service to be completed during each year of probation.

RESTITUTION REQUESTED by the State:  $73,404.50 to Kettle Moraine School District.
Defense is contesting the restitution and requesting a restitution hearing.
Restitution hearing to be set.


Restitution:  $16,109.63 to R.R. Insurance, Joint/several with co-actors.
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME:
45 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion (agent to determine straight-time or with huber).  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  AS TO COUNT 2 ONLY (doesn't include count 3).






Count 3:
9 Months in the Waukesha County Jail 
First 6 Months is to be Straight-Time.
Last 3 Months to be served w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Defendant to report to the jail no later than 6 pm on 05/16/16.


Costs:  $243
To be paid as a Condition of Probation on count 2.  

Restitution hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
